Project Website

Analysis of New York City’s Educational Environment: Accessibility, Performance, and Safety

About

This website is designed to provide a clearer understanding of the educational environment in New York City and visualize regional disparities in education. Although education should offer equal opportunities for all, significant differences exist between regions. This project analyzes three key aspects— educational facility accessibility, academic performance, and safety—to highlight these inequalities.

Educational Facility Accessibility: Visualizing the density of schools by school zones to analyze how easily students can access educational facilities in different areas.

Academic Performance: Using standardized test scores to compare academic outcomes across regions and provide specific data on the quality of education.

Safety: Showing the safety levels of different areas based on crime data around schools, helping students and parents make informed decisions when choosing schools.

All data is visualized separately for elementary schools, middle schools, and high schools, allowing for detailed analysis of disparities at each educational stage.

This project serves as a resource for New York City residents to consider when choosing where to live, and provides policymakers with data-driven insights to ensure the fair distribution of educational resources.
